prompt: If @ means >, # means <, $ means =, % means ≥, & means ≤. P @ Q # R. Which is true?
If A $ B means A = B, A # B means A < B, A @ B means A > B. If P @ Q $ R, then?
explanation: P > Q, Q = R. So P > Q = R.

prompt: If * means ≥, + means >, - means <, = means ≤. M * N + O - P. Which is true?
explanation: M ≥ N, N > O, O < P. So M ≥ N > O < P.

prompt: Codes: △ = >, ○ = <, □ = ≥, ◇ = ≤. If A △ B ○ C, which is true?
If P @ Q means P > Q, P # Q means P < Q, P $ Q means P = Q. Given X @ Y $ Z # W. Conclusions: I. X > Z II. W > Y
explanation: X > Y = Z < W. So X > Z (I) and W > Y = Z, so W > Y (II). Both true.

prompt: Codes: & = ≤, % = ≥, @ = <, # = >. A % B @ C # D. Which is true?
explanation: A ≥ B, B < C, C > D.

prompt: If + means >, - means <, * means =, / means ≥. X / Y + Z * W. Conclusions: I. X ≥ Z II. Y < W
explanation: X ≥ Y > Z = W. X ≥ Y > Z, so X > Z (I true). Y > Z = W, so Y > W not Y < W (II false).

prompt: Codes: α = >, β = <, γ = ≥, δ = ≤. P γ Q β R δ S. Which is true?
explanation: P ≥ Q, Q < R, R ≤ S.

prompt: If M © N means M ≥ N, M ® N means M ≤ N, M ¥ N means M > N. Given A © B ¥ C ® D. I. A ≥ C II. B > D
explanation: A ≥ B > C ≤ D. A ≥ B > C, so A > C (I true). B > C ≤ D, B-D uncertain (II not definite).

prompt: Codes: $ = <, # = >, @ = ≤, % = ≥. X % Y $ Z # W. Conclusions: I. X ≥ Y II. Z < W
explanation: X ≥ Y, Y < Z, Z > W. Wait: X ≥ Y, Y < Z, Z > W. So I true (X ≥ Y). Z > W means Z > W not Z < W. Recheck: $ = <, so Y $ Z means Y < Z. # = >, Z # W means Z > W. So Z > W, not Z < W. II is false.

prompt: If A ∆ B means A > B, A ∇ B means A < B, A ○ B means A = B. Given P ∆ Q ○ R ∇ S. Which is true?
explanation: P > Q, Q = R, R < S. So P > Q = R < S.
M ≥ N > O ≤ P. M ≥ N > O, so M > O (I true). N > O ≤ P, N-P uncertain (II not definite).
A ≥ B > C ≤ D < E. A ≥ B > C, so A > C (I true). D < E, so D < E not D ≥ E (II false).
X ≥ Y, Y < Z, Z > W, W ≤ V. I true (X ≥ Y). Z > W means Z > W not Z < W. Wait: + = <, so Y + Z means Y < Z. - = >, Z - W means Z > W. So Z > W. II says Z < W which is false.

prompt: If P * Q = P > Q, P # Q = P ≤ Q, P @ Q = P < Q. Given A * B # C @ D. I. A > C II. B ≤ D
explanation: A > B, B ≤ C, C < D. A > B ≤ C, A-C uncertain. B ≤ C < D, B-D uncertain. Neither definite.
